root.TEXT:
Record date: 2082-10-01
EDVISIT^51639357^Noonan, France^10/01/82^ELROD, RYLEY
This patient was seen on 10/01/2082 with the resident, Dr.
Jacob. Please see her note for details. The resident's
history and physical examination were reviewed and confirmed.
Please see her note for details. The plan of care and
disposition of the patient were discussed with the resident.
IMPRESSION: This is a 70-year-old male who presents with two
weeks of back pain radiating from the mid back to the chest. He
also has pain in his left leg up to his flank. He also has some
scrotal swelling and lower abdominal pain. The pain has been
intermittent and the patient has been taking Vicodin for the past
two days. The pain that he has been having is actually chronic,
except for the left-sided flank pain and the chest pain. He was
found on the ground by his daughter, and it was unclear to the
patient how he ended up in that position.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Significant for myocardial infarction,
atrial fibrillation, diabetes, cerebrovascular accident, low back
pain, sciatica, Bell palsy, reflux, osteochondritis, peripheral
vascular disease, and diabetic neuropathy.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: The patient is afebrile, heart rate 80,
respirations 16, blood pressure 126/82, and oxygen saturation is
100%. He is in severe distress. His lung exam is normal. His
cardiac examination shows no abnormality. His abdomen is
distended, and there is tenderness to palpation in the left lower
quadrant, and there is CVA tenderness in the left flank. There
is also significant pain on movement of his left leg either
passively or actively. It is not possible for us to evaluate the
strength in his left hip or knee because of pain. He is alert
and oriented to person, place, time, and event. His cranial
nerves are intact. Rectal examination shows mildly decreased
sphincter tone, but no evidence of saddle anesthesia.
LABORATORY STUDIES: Show a CK of 128 with MB fraction of 3.8,
and troponin I is less than assay. INR is 2.8. UA shows 0 to 1
white blood cells and 1 to 2 red blood cells. Electrocardiogram
shows atrial fibrillation with bradycardic rate of 47. His head
CT shows no abnormality. There is stranding around his left
kidney. The aorta appears normal.
EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT COURSE: The patient was given an aspirin
325 mg p.o. and morphine 4 mg IV for pain. His pain improved
significantly. However, he had another recurrence of the pain
and with rising discomfort. It was decided to admit the patient
to the hospital for management of his pain and further workup to
******** Not reviewed by Attending Physician ********
markedly bradycardic.
______________________________
ELROD, RYLEY M.D.
D: 10/23/82
T: 10/23/82
Dictated By: ELROD, RYLEY
